Congress, Bay State hold off cuts to military installations

Two major military bases in Mass. threatened with closure or cutbacks were spared as part of legislation that helped leaders retain defense-related in-state jobs. (Globe)
  • 11/12 Mass. defense industry watching Warren closely
  • 6/26 Defense cuts due to hit Mass. hard  |  Discuss

Prep school failed to report impropriety

Despite knowing that its headmaster had an improper relationship with a student, publishing executive Steve Forbes (left), who led the school’s board at the time, didn't alert the authorities, the school said. (Globe)
pictures

Snow business like N.E.'s ski business

Last year, we were lamenting one of the worst ski seasons on record. But now, up to four feet of snow has fallen in New England, giving skiers exactly what they want.

US jobless rate holds at 7.8 percent

The US economy made slow progress last month as employers kept hiring cautiously while political leaders brought the nation to the edge of the fiscal cliff. (Globe)

Tributes grow for Hub's first black officer

The Boston Police Department today is set to unveil a plaque for Sergeant Horatio J. Homer at the Area B-2 police precinct in ­Roxbury, the latest honor bestowed upon the pioneering member of the city's force. (Globe)

N. Andover-based Giant Glass sold

The sale to Safelite, rumored for more than a week, was finished Monday, ending 34 years of local ownership by Dennis Drinkwater and Lance Cramer. (Boston Globe)
